t: Isaiah 26
The Song of Judah
On*p that day this song will be sung in the land of Judah: We*pn have a strong city. Salvation*ln is established as walls and ramparts.
Open*ln the gates so*ln a righteous nation can come in — one*ln that remains faithful.
You*ln will keep the mind that is dependent on you in*ln perfect peace, for*ln it is trusting in you.
Trust*ln in the Lord*s forever, because*ln in the Lord,*s the Lord*s himself, is an everlasting rock!
For*ln he has humbled those who live in lofty places — an*ln inaccessible city. He*ln brings it down; he brings it down to the ground; he*ln throws it to the dust.
Feet*ln trample it, the*ln feet of the humble, the*ln steps of the poor.
God’s People Vindicated
The*pn path of the righteous is level; you*ln clear a straight path for the righteous.
Yes,*ln Lord,*s we wait for you in*ln the path of your judgments. Our*ln desire is for your name and renown.
I*ln long for you in the night; yes,*ln my spirit within me diligently seeks you, for*ln when your judgments are in the land, the*ln inhabitants of the world will learn righteousness.
But*ln if the wicked man is shown favor, he*ln does not learn righteousness. In*ln a righteous land he acts unjustly and*ln does not see the majesty of the Lord.*s
Lord,*sln your hand is lifted up to take action, but*ln they do not see it. Let*ln them see your zeal for your people and*ln be put to shame. Let*ln fire consume your adversaries.
Lord,*sln you will establish peace for us, for*ln you have also done all our work for us.
Lord*sln our God, lords other than you have owned us, but*ln we remember your name alone.
The*pn dead do not live; departed*ln spirits do not rise up. Indeed,*ln you have punished and destroyed them; you*ln have wiped out all memory of them.
You*ln have added to the nation, Lord.*s You*ln have added to the nation; you are honored. You*ln have expanded all the borders of the land.
Lord,*sln they went to you in their distress; they*ln poured out whispered prayers because*ln your discipline fell on them.
As*ln a pregnant woman about to give birth writhes*ln and cries out in her pains, so*ln we were before you, Lord.*s
We*ln became pregnant, we writhed in pain; we*ln gave birth to wind. We*ln have won no victories on earth, and*ln the earth’s inhabitants have not fallen.
Your*pn dead will live; their bodies will rise. Awake*ln and sing, you who dwell in the dust! For*ln you will be covered with the morning dew, and*ln the earth will bring out the departed spirits.
Go,*pn my people, enter your rooms and*ln close your doors behind you. Hide*ln for a little while until the wrath has passed.
For*ln look, the Lord*s is coming from his place to*ln punish the inhabitants of the earth for their iniquity. The*ln earth will reveal the blood shed on it and*ln will no longer conceal her slain.
